sen.j: 坂上大野（さかのうえ の おおの）は、坂上田村麻呂の長男。
sen.e: SAKANOUE no Ono was the first son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
SAKANOUE no Ono was the first son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
SAKANOUE no Ono was the first son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
He was the Gon no suke (provisional vice governor) of Mutsu.
He was the Gon no suke (provisional vice governor) of Mutsu.
He was the Gon no suke (provisional vice governor) of Mutsu.

sen.j: 弟に坂上広野、坂上浄野、坂上正野がいる。
sen.e: His younger brothers include SAKANOUE no Hirono, SAKANOUE no Kiyono, and SAKANOUE no Masano.
His younger brothers include SAKANOUE no Hirono, SAKANOUE no Kiyono, and SAKANOUE no Masano.
His younger brothers include SAKANOUE no Hirono, SAKANOUE no Kiyono, and SAKANOUE no Masano.

sen.j: 父の田村麻呂の後を継ぎ、東北経営に従事するが早世した。
sen.e: He succeeded his father, Tamuramaro, and engaged in the management of Tohoku, but he died young.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He succeeded his father, Tamuramaro, and engaged in the management of Tohoku, but he died young.
He succeeded his father, Tamuramaro, and engaged in the management of Tohoku, but he died young.

sen.j: 坂上氏の家督は弟の広野が継ぐ。
sen.e: His younger brother, Hirono succeeded the headship of the Sakanoue clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His younger brother, Hirono succeeded the headship of the Sakanoue clan.
His younger brother, Hirono succeeded the headship of the Sakanoue clan.

sen.j: 子の坂上氏高は春宮権少進として都にいたようだ。
sen.e: His son, Sakanoue no Ujitaka, seems to have been in the capital as Shungu (the Court for the Crown Prince) gonno-shoshin (Junior Office Secretary).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His son, SAKANOUE no Ujitaka, seems to have been in the capital as Shungu (the Court for the Crown Prince) gonno-shoshin (Junior Office Secretary).
His son, SAKANOUE no Ujitaka, seems to have been in the capital as Shungu (the Court for the Crown Prince) gonno-shoshin (Junior Office Secretary).

sen.j: その子の坂上樹並は秋田城介となっているから、坂上氏伝来の東北経営に従事したのであろう。
sen.e: He was probably engaged in the management of Tohoku, the responsibility passed down in the Sakanoue clan, because his son, Sakanoue no 樹並 in that Akitajo no suke (provincial governor of Akita-jo castle in Dewa Province).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処樹並は、読み不明
sen.e: His son SAKANOUE no 樹並 was probably engaged in the management of Tohoku, which was the hereditary of the Sakanoue clan, as he is said have been the Akitajo no suke (provincial governor of Akita-jo castle in Dewa Province).
sen.cmt: ”東北経営に従事したのは坂上樹並”と理解し、修正しました。「樹並」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: His son SAKANOUE no 樹並 was probably engaged in the management of Tohoku, which was the hereditary of the Sakanoue clan, as he is said have been the Akitajo no suke (provincial governor of Akita-jo castle in Dewa Province).
